Reviews.Title: “Simple”
Reviews.Author: Alan_X_10
Reviews.Content: A fantastic find, recommended by a friend, this small hotel just off Schonhauser Alle is a little haven of calm. Rooms are clean, clear and simple. Also huge. The staff are friendly, and the whole experience was great. The hotel is very quiet, but perfectly located for hundreds of bars and restaurants with a convenience store on the corner and the U-bahn passing almost outside the door for a quick trip in to see the sights of Berlin. Fantastic value, looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price, service and quality”
Reviews.Author: Valichon
Reviews.Content: We went to this hostel with my partner after booking it online. The particularity is that there is no reception desk but an intercom. The person in charge arrived one minute after we buzzed, gave us the parking card to park righ in front of the hotel, and gave us the key to the room. And that was the best surprise : huge bathroom, beautiful room with brand new furniture and fully equipped (fridge, corkscrew...). Concerning the location it is great : three U-Bahn stops from the famous Alexanderplatz (so you can travel with the discount short-distance ticket), rent-a-bike for 10 euros a day, safe neighborhood. I really recommend the place for an student-budget friendly romantic stay in Berlin !

Reviews.Title: “RUN AWAY”
Reviews.Author: XRISTINA77
Reviews.Content: I have visited Berlin several times but that was my first in Hotel 1A apartment. This time I wanted specifically to stay in Prenzlauer Berg since I was visiting a friend that stayed in the area and I wanted to be close. My reservation was about two double rooms for an eight night stay. Since there was not a 24 hour reception and I was arriving late at evening I had asked my friend to go in advance and collect the keys for the rooms. When the date arrived my friend went to pick up the keys but she came up with an unpleasant surprise. The hotel could verify just the one of the two reservations and they could give the keys for just one of the two double rooms. The incident happened just 2 hours before the departure of my flight. At the time my friend called me I was in the airport, about to check in. The hotel insisted that it was not their mistake but mine. I had to call booking.com, which was the provider of the room. Booking com had informed me that it was 100 per cent mistake of the hotel and they called the hotel to solve the problem. It was after 1 hour and several calls from booking com that hotel 1a apartment realize that they had lost the confirmation fax of my reservation. And it was after one more hour that they gave me a solution. Their first proposal was to put 2 extra beds and to have me share the second double room with my friends. Of course I refused so then they proposed me to go and stay in an other hotel in a double room with shared bathroom. No need to mention that my original reservation was about a double room with a private bathroom. After several calls they finally accepted to put me in an other-more expensive- hotel in the area. If I knew what I would have to put through I would have never made the first reservation. This hotel is totally unprofessional. I was truly lucky to have my friend there otherwise I would have arrived in Berlin around midnight and I would have been in a foreign city without a place to stay. My advise<<STAY AWAY>>!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in lively neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Andre50
Reviews.Content: As there is no breakfast room, this place would hardly qualify as a hotel, but who cares? Places to have breakfast are all around. At some of these, they serve breakfast until the end of the afternoon. The rooms at the 1A are nice and clean and come with a fridge and a (small) television. Free coffee is available in the reception area day and night. Tram and U-bahn (Underground, although it is running overground on a monumental viaduct just around the corner) give easy access to many of the famous city centre sites, like Hackescher Markt, Alexanderplatz, Potsdammer Platz. However, the area around the 1A is worth a visit in its own right, with many 'Gründerzeit' or art nouveau dwellings.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE - WITH ONE MINOR DOWNSIDE”
Reviews.Author: PAUL048
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed in August 2008 and was most impressed by the large bedroom and equally large bathroom I had. My previous comments still apply, but this time with one bad point: the small washbasin in the small bathroom had a large-ish glass shelf above it which made it difficult to brush my teeth properly. Aside from that I do like this place. Had 3 excellent day trips to Lubbenau, Leipzig and Dresden (thoroughly recommend Dresden)

Reviews.Title: “Basic and cheap - but clean and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: EnglandExile
Reviews.Content: Not 5 star by any means, but clean, comfortable and extremely convenient. M1 tram takes you into Mitte in 15 minutes. Prenzlauer Berg is interesting, with lots of bars, cafes, restaurants, and a couple of historical sights such as the Water Tower and the Synagogue. A lively area, with a large gay community, but my 70 year old female companion felt perfectly happy with the location. Bed was comfortable, bathroom had adequate shower and sink, there is a fridge and an iron/ironing board available. The lobby has a coffee machine and free internet access. There are no staff on site but someone is on call when needed.

Reviews.Title: “great place in Prenzlauerberg”
Reviews.Author: grassgrowing
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious and stylishly furnished. Transport is close by and Mitte is easily walkable. There are parks around that are good to run around. This area of Prenzlauerberg is a little out of the action, but the room is affordable, cleaned everyday and I enjoyed my time here.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a local. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: LagunaGrrl
Reviews.Content: Not in a touristy area, this is a good location for folks who want to stay in "East Berlin" and still have good access to the train for sightseeing. The person who showed me the room was friendly, but then I never saw anyone again. This is fine if you're not looking for a lot of attention, but would be an issue if you want to stay in a place that has front desk staff - there's no front desk here. My room was really small, as was the bathroom - but both were tidy and everything well-maintained. My room was on the "inside" of the building, looking out onto a courtyard. Avoid a street-side room, especially on the first floor, which didn't look like it got a whole lot of privacy. There are several food options nearby and a great little shop a few yards away that had everything I needed (water, snacks). I felt totally safe walking around alone at night and the proximity to the train is great. The wireless internet was excellent. All-in-all I can recommend this as an option over staying at a hostel. But it's not really a "hotel" - it's really like staying in an apartment building. It worked for me and I'd have no problem staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: AntigenBand
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for New Years 2008->2009. Nice clean place, rooms a nice size. Free internet on-site (on their computer), which is a great plus. Very friendly people. Small grocery store right across the street proved convenient. 5 mins walk to subway stop, from which the rest of Berlin is yours within 10 mins tops (Berlin's subway system is incredibly fast and frequent-running). On this note, you probably want to spring for a public transit pass for a few days, which is great since Berlin is too big to walk across anyway. Quiet area of town a plus.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: brdgr007chris
Reviews.Content: 1-A is my favorite place to stay in Berlin. The double rooms are large, comfortable and clean, with a seating area, in-room bathroom (bring your soap and shampoo), TV and daily housekeeping; the prices are very reasonable and the personnel are very helpful and friendly. There is a coffee machine in the lobby as well as an internet terminal, so your stay is even more comfortable. 1-A is located in Prenzlauer Berg, a popular neighborhood east of Mitte and the neighborhood is full of bars, clubs and restaurants, and there is a market at the end of the block. Public transportation is very close, with a tram stop at the end of the block and 2 U-Bahn stations within a couple of blocks. I have stayed here many times over the last couple of years, and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain and Location”
Reviews.Author: HomelessEastCoast
Reviews.Content: In June 2008 I spent a week at the 1A Pension. I also stayed there for a week a year ago. The rooms are immaculately clean as is the entire facility. This pension is located on a side street and therefore is quiet. The place was filled to capacity when I was there and yet I had no feeling that other guests were in the place. The staff is cordial and efficient. The manager is most helpful at all times and gave me good bits of advice relative to what to do and see in the area. The place is close to streetcar, bus and subway lines which connect to the entire city. One can also walk to "Mitte" which is in the heart of Berlin. Restaurants and grocery stores are within a block of the Pension. The prices are reasonable and I recommend it highly to anyone wanting a good location and decent lodgings. I plan to return there next year as well. Jim S.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: KurtBuh
Reviews.Content: I was over in Berlin with my wife to catch a glimpse of the Berlin film festival, and as we had predicted we wouldn't have that much time to idle around in a hotel, we opted for budget accommodation like this. I usually dread staying in such places, as my idea of staying in a near-filthy room isn't exactly appealing. But how wrong I had been. This accommodation indeed turned out to be an excellent punt in all respects. Importantly, despite not being exactly within walking distance of the centre (took about 10 minutes by taxi to get back from Alexander Platz at 2am) it is superbly located only around 200m from the U2 underground line, meaning getting to the more central areas is a matter of less than 10 minutes. The area is extremely quiet, there is a supermarket (Kaiser's) located just opposite the flat, a 24-hour amenity store run by what seemed like a Turkish family 1-minute away down the road, and a big shopping mall (Schönhauser Allee Arcaden), cinema (Colosseum) and plenty of take-aways in the main road (Schönhauser Allee) nearby. Room was extremely clean and the owners certainly have good tastes in decor. As some reviewers have ponted out here and elsewhere, the only downside is that it lacks proper reception, but who needs it after all? I'd certainly go back there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Apartment”
Reviews.Author: carroll1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Apartment 1a for 3 nights December '07. It's in a good location in Prenzlauer Berg which has many bars/restaurants, and also there is a 24hr supermarket literally 2 minutes down the road. Which was handy! Its about a five-ten minute walk to the nearest u-bahn. There is no reception, but you can contact the owner if needs be, and he proved to be really nice and helpful. There is a coffee/tea vending machine in the entrance area and free internet, which was always available when I wanted to use the PC. The room was large, spacious and clean. There were towels, and a hand hairdryer. Make sure you pack your own soap though. I enjoyed my stay at Apartment 1A, I had a peaceful night's sleep and I liked the location.

Reviews.Title: “1A Apartment & Pension in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: no breakfast in house, next train station you must walking a long distance

Reviews.Title: “Lovely guesthouse !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in double room, v comfortable large rooms with sofa, table and chairs, tv, v clean and tidy. Small bathroom in relation to the huge room but v nice decorated. No reception/room service like standard hotel but there was an instant coffee making machine in lobby. No hairdryer or soap so remember to take your own. Towels supplied. Excellent buffet breakfast around the corner and hotel is a stones throw away from the Shoenhauser Allee. Tram and Underground v nearby so easy access to Alexandra Platz. Owners v friendly and helpful. Excellently priced 64e/room per night and would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: 1A Apartment Guesthouse and Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Milastrasse 6, 10437 Berlin, Germany
